dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2018, October 5th, the Ministry of Digital Development in Kazakhstan announced this huge rural internet project.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty eighteen, October fifth, the Ministry of Digital Development in Kazakhstan announced this huge rural internet project.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it's a public-private partnership, um, involving Transtelecom and Kazakhtelecom, among others.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it's a public-private partnership, um, involving Transtelecom and Kazakhtelecom, among others.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the official ceremony holding on October 4, 2018, the Ministry of information and communications of Republic of Kazakhstan, Transtelecom JSC, the consortium SilkNetCom LLP, and Kazakhtelecom JSC have signed the PPP agreement for the project named Providing broadband access to rural areas of the Republic of Kazakhstan using the technology of fiber-optical communication lines.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the CEO of Transtelecom, Zhanbolat Nadyrov, was there talking about how it'll help bridge the digital divide.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the C E O of Transtelecom, Zhanbolat Nadyrov, was there talking about how it'll help bridge the digital divide.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zhanbolat Nadyrov, CEO of Transtelecom JSC, represented the company. As a result of project implementation, digital inequality level will be decreased.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They're planning to lay down something like 5,800 kilometers of fiber-optic cable along the railways.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're planning to lay down something like five thousand, eight hundred kilometers of fiber-optic cable along the railways.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That is a massive undertaking. And the speeds they're promising—up to 25 Mbit/s for hundreds of villages and schools.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is a massive undertaking. And the speeds they're promising-up to twenty five megabits per second for hundreds of villages and schools.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, like over 400 rural settlements and 1,200 schools and hospitals are gonna get connected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, like over four hundred rural settlements and twelve hundred schools and hospitals are gonna get connected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they want to get 50 villages online by the end of the first year, which is pretty ambitious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they want to get fifty villages online by the end of the first year, which is pretty ambitious.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was reported that already this year, TTC will provide 48 villages and 150 local state bodies with Internet access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it's a 12-year project overall, so they're thinking long-term. Nadyrov mentioned it's a foundation for future stuff too—smart schools, telemedicine…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's a twelve-year project overall, so they're thinking long-term. Nadyrov mentioned it's a foundation for future stuff too-smart schools, telemedicine...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The project realization period is expected to be 13 years. Zhanbolat Nadyrov also added that the project will be implemented with the long term prospects, so the fiber-optic infrastructure will become as the foundation for a number of future projects such as Smart schools, telemedicine and safe city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, safe cities as well. It's not just about internet access; it's about building out digital services for everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, safe cities as well. It's not just about internet access; it's about building out digital services for everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zhanbolat Nadyrov also added that the project will be implemented with the long term prospects, so the fiber-optic infrastructure will become as the foundation for a number of future projects such as Smart schools, telemedicine and safe city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the economic impact—better digital literacy, more e-commerce opportunities for people in those areas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the economic impact-better digital literacy, more e-commerce opportunities for people in those areas.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Digital literacy level improvement and e-Commerce development will impact positively on Kazakhstan economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting that they're using existing rail infrastructure to deploy the fiber. Makes sense logistically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting that they're using existing rail infrastructure to deploy the fiber. Makes sense logistically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thus, within the framework of the project, TTC will conduct 6,000 km of fiber-optic communication wires along the railways, which will provide 421 rural settlements and 1222 local schools, hospitals, local state bodies, police stations and other institutions with the Internet access at a high speed of 20 Mbit/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure, and Transtelecom's got experience in telecom and system integration, so they're well-suited for this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure, and Transtelecom's got experience in telecom and system integration, so they're well-suited for this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Transtelecom JSC is one of the largest communication operators in the Republic of Kazakhstan that specialize in provision of a wide range of telecommunication services, digitalization and system integration in the field of IT, communications, automation and energy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, uh, connecting government offices and police stations too—that's gonna improve public service efficiency big time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, uh, connecting government offices and police stations too-that's gonna improve public service efficiency big time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The efficiency and quality of work of rural public servants will improve significantly as they will be able to cooperate with the regional and state centers more effectively, Nadyrov said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. This could be a model for other countries with large rural connectivity gaps.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. This could be a model for other countries with large rural connectivity gaps.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Twelve years is a long rollout, but if they pull it off, it'll be transformative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twelve years is a long rollout, but if they pull it off, it'll be transformative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The project realization period is expected to be 13 years.

artist_script:
Back in 2018, October 5th, the Ministry of Digital Development in Kazakhstan announced this huge rural internet project.
HostB: Right, and it’s a public-private partnership, um, involving Transtelecom and Kazakhtelecom, among others.
HostA: Yeah, and the CEO of Transtelecom, Zhanbolat Nadyrov, was there talking about how it’ll help bridge the digital divide.
HostB: They’re planning to lay down something like 5,800 kilometers of fiber-optic cable along the railways.
HostA: That is a massive undertaking. And the speeds they’re promising—up to 25 Mbit/s for hundreds of villages and schools.
HostB: Exactly, like over 400 rural settlements and 1,200 schools and hospitals are gonna get connected.
HostA: And they want to get 50 villages online by the end of the first year, which is pretty ambitious.
HostB: But it’s a 12-year project overall, so they’re thinking long-term. Nadyrov mentioned it’s a foundation for future stuff too—smart schools, telemedicine…
HostA: Oh yeah, safe cities as well. It’s not just about internet access; it’s about building out digital services for everyone.
HostB: And the economic impact—better digital literacy, more e-commerce opportunities for people in those areas.
HostA: It’s interesting that they’re using existing rail infrastructure to deploy the fiber. Makes sense logistically.
HostB: For sure, and Transtelecom’s got experience in telecom and system integration, so they’re well-suited for this.
HostA: I mean, uh, connecting government offices and police stations too—that’s gonna improve public service efficiency big time.
HostB: Absolutely. This could be a model for other countries with large rural connectivity gaps.
HostA: Twelve years is a long rollout, but if they pull it off, it’ll be transformative.
